channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Streetlight not working, 4th December
item.description:
First lamppost on left entering Lambourn Close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lambourn Close, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous split in path height - pedestrians and cyclists, 4th December
item.description:
The problem is located along Folly Lane, on the approach to the left hand turn to join the Honeybourne Line. As shown in the photos, there is a significant step down in the height of the path, in which I caught my front wheel when cycling this morning and fell off. The position of the barriers just after the left hand turn (red and white) shown in the photos, means that cyclists approaching this from this side will likely be riding in this channel. It is difficult to see the change in height and led to a sudden loss of control. Can anything be done to alleviate this please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
